cscie97.asn2.ecommerce.product

Interface IProductAPI


  • public interface IProductAPI
    A public API for interacting with the Mobile Application Store which allowed for the importation of new Content items as well as provides a search interface for that Content. Customers may use the API to search for Content items and supply detailed search criteria. Application Developers and Administrators may use the API to add new Content items, new Country items, and new Device by passing in filenames of CSV files with all data. Note that adding items to the product catalog is a "restricted interface"; only users that supply a valid access token (e.g., GUID) value to methods for importing/adding content will be allowed. Later an Authentication Service API will be built that will handle the actual authentication and authorization parts; the current version of the ProductAPI will only simulate the presence of a functional Authentication Service by accepting and requiring GUIDs be passed to restricted interface methods (e.g., content creation). The ProductAPI is a Singleton, so there is only ever one instance to use. Additionally, the ProductAPI uses the Flyweight pattern to ensure that there is only ever one instance of each Content, Device, and Country object so as to not needlessly duplicate things and waste memory and resources.
    See Also:
    ProductAPI, Content, ContentSearch

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        IProductAPI getInstance()
        Returns a reference to the single static instance of the ProductAPI.
        Returns:
        singleton instance of the ProductAPI

      • validateAccessToken

        boolean validateAccessToken(java.lang.String guid)
        Verifies that the guid access token passed is authenticated and authorized for carrying out restricted actions on the ProductAPI (such as adding new Content items, etc.). Note that for this version of the ProductAPI, this method is mocked and will return true for any string passed.
        Parameters:
        guid - the string access token to check for authentication and authorization for carrying out restricted actions on the ProductAPI
        Returns:
        true if guid is authenticated and authorized to execute restricted actions on ProductAPI, false otherwise

      • importCountries

        void importCountries(java.lang.String filename)
                     throws ImportException,
                            ParseException
        Public method for importing countries into the product catalog. Every Content item has a list of Countries that the content item may be exported to. Checks for valid input file name. Throws ImportException on error accessing or processing the input Country file.
        Parameters:
        filename - file with countries to load into the Product catalog
        Throws:
        ImportException - thrown when encountering non-parse related exceptions in the import process
        ParseException - thrown when encountering any issues parsing the input file related to the format of the file contents

      • importDevices

        void importDevices(java.lang.String filename)
                   throws ImportException,
                          ParseException
        Public method for importing devices into the product catalog. Every Content item has a list of supported Devices that the content item may be used on. Checks for valid input file name. Throws ImportException on error accessing or processing the input Device file.
        Parameters:
        filename - file with supported devices to load into the Product catalog
        Throws:
        ImportException - thrown when encountering non-parse related exceptions in the import process
        ParseException - thrown when encountering any issues parsing the input file related to the format of the file contents

      • importContent

        void importContent(java.lang.String filename)
                   throws ImportException,
                          ParseException
        Public method for importing Content items into the product catalog. Every Content item has a list of supported Devices, and a list of Countries that the content item may be downloaded in. Checks for valid input file name. Throws ImportException on error accessing or processing the input Content file.
        Parameters:
        filename - file with content items to load into the Product catalog
        Throws:
        ImportException - thrown when encountering non-parse related exceptions in the import process
        ParseException - thrown when encountering any issues parsing the input file related to the format of the file contents

      • addCountry

        void addCountry(java.lang.String guid,
              java.lang.String code,
              java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String exportStatus)
        Restricted interface only for authenticated users. When passed an authorized guid, allows authenticated users the ability to add new Country items into the Product catalog. There is only one instance of each Country object in the Product catalog at any time (follows the Flyweight pattern); attempts to add a pre-existing country will not do anything since the Country already exists in the catalog.
        Parameters:
        guid - a string token for a validated and authenticated user to allow restricted interface actions
        code - 2-character country code
        name - the full name of the country to add
        exportStatus - can be one of: "open", "closed"
